title: In Announcing Pardon of Drug Trafficker While Threatening Venezuela, Trump Displays Contradictions
summary: President Trump’s statements on social media less than 24 hours apart showed the dissonance in his campaign against drug trafficking.

title: The Ex-President Whom Trump Plans to Pardon Flooded America With Cocaine
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández, whom Mr. Trump called a victim of persecution, helped orchestrate a decades-long trafficking conspiracy. It ravaged his Central American country.

title: Trump Declares Venezuelan Airspace Closed
summary: President Trump said days earlier that the United States could “very soon” expand its campaign of killing people at sea suspected of drug trafficking to attacking Venezuelan territory.

title: Several Arrested as Protesters Block ICE Agents From a Potential Raid in NYC
summary: The confrontation appeared to foil a possible ICE raid nearby, underscoring the numerous challenges the federal government faces in trying to stage raids in a dense city like New York.

title: F.D.A. Seeks More Oversight of Vaccine Trials and Approvals
summary: The agency’s top vaccine regulator proposed broad changes, claiming that a new review linked 10 children’s deaths to the Covid vaccine. But public health experts questioned the findings, wanting to examine the data.

title: Trump Frees Fraudster Just Days Into Seven-Year Prison Sentence
summary: David Gentile had been found guilty for his role in what prosecutors described as a $1.6 billion scheme that defrauded thousands of investors.

title: Top Trump Aides to Meet With Ukrainians in Florida on Sunday
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner plan to discuss peace terms again after an uproar over a 28-point proposal drafted with Russian input.

title: Inside Trump’s Push to Make the White House Ballroom as Big as Possible
summary: President Trump’s ever-growing vision has caused tension with contractors. His architect has taken a step back as the president personally manages the project.

title: Webster Springs, W.Va. United In Grief Over Death of National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom
summary: In Webster Springs, everyone knows one another. When National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom was killed, that connection was even further strengthened.

title: Afghans Who Assisted U.S. During the War Underwent Rigorous Vetting
summary: Former officials said the C.I.A. diligently assessed those who partnered with its forces, like the man accused of shooting two National Guard members in Washington.

title: How Fraud Swamped Minnesota’s Social Services System on Tim Walz’s Watch
summary: Prosecutors say members of the Somali diaspora, a group with growing political power, were largely responsible. President Trump has drawn national attention to the scandal amid his crackdown on immigration.

title: Political Confusion as Texas Awaits Supreme Court’s Ruling on Redistricting
summary: A decision on the state’s new congressional map will affect five House seats and could help determine control of the chamber next year.

title: Republicans Flipped South Texas. Can a Moderate Tejano Singer Take It Back?
summary: The star power of Latin Grammy Award-winning Bobby Pulido has Democrats dreaming of taking a U.S. House district in South Texas, even though Republicans have redrawn it in their favor.

title: Ahead of Primary Elections, Time Is Running Out in the Fight Over Congressional Maps
summary: As partisan battles rage and courts wrangle proposals, the relentless pace of the calendar will force states to act — or land in murky legal ground.

title: Fed Up With the Taliban, Pakistan Expels Masses of Afghans
summary: Labeling Afghans a national security threat, Pakistan has forced out about a million this year, depriving them of a haven from Afghanistan’s turmoil.

title: America Has Sidelined Education. You Can Help.
summary: The New York Times Communities Fund has partnered with charities that invest in education at critical junctures across people’s life spans.

title: Apocalypse Now
summary: Apocalyptic predictions may actually serve as comforting fantasies, at which point our future freakouts become an excuse for inaction.

title: 4 Dead After Shooting at Banquet Hall in California
summary: The shooting in Stockton, a city in California’s Central Valley, left 11 others wounded. The authorities said they were looking for a suspect.

title: Mourners Honor Victims of Hong Kong Apartment Fire
summary: The police said they expected the death toll of 128 to rise as the authorities began combing through the charred apartment towers.

title: Did Pope Leo Pray in Istanbul’s Blue Mosque? Not Visibly, at Least.
summary: Leo XIV is being closely watched on an inaugural trip to Turkey and Lebanon to spread a message of peace and outreach.

title: Syria Tiptoes Toward Transitional Justice One Year After Assad’s Ouster
summary: Fourteen people are on trial, charged with crimes related to an outbreak of sectarian violence under the new government. The abuses of the old Assad regime still await a reckoning.
